column8: DAP to hold re-election ‘under protest’PUTRAJAYA: DAP says it is prepared to hold a re-election for its central executive committee (CEC) as directed by the Registrar of Societies (RoS), but that it will be held “under protest”.DAP vice-chairman Teresa Kok said this was in view of the fact that the directive was given to them during a period in which the 14th general election could be called at any time.“We will hold a re-election for the CEC at a special congress as stipulated in our party’s constitution.“We will also appoint PKF Consulting, an independent auditor, to monitor the election,” she said after handing over a letter to the RoS today.Also present were several DAP leaders including national organising secretary Anthony Loke, youth chief Teo Kok Seong, Sabah DAP chairman Stephen Wong and assemblymen Eddie Ng and Ng Sze Han.Kok’s announcement today came two days after the party’s secretary-general Lim Guan Eng reiterated that it would not hold a re-election for its CEC members as ordered by the RoS.http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...-under-protest/
